size to suit yarns of the same weight with good your yarn and ideally shorter than the contrast between the two it s trickier circumference you want to knit pg 3 to knit and you lose some of the effect yarn requirements i used 2 skeins of if you use a variegated yarn that has rowan renew for a finished size of 60 patches that are the same colour as the cm around x 20cm tall 24 x 8 this other yarn makes a single loop which is tall enough to be folded in half you could also make a double loop half as high with the same amount of yarn if you wanted to display both sides at once i d recommend a minimum of 100m of each yarn for this size gauge isn t critical but may affect yarn requirements see pg 3 technique used the cowl is knitted on a circular needle but you will not knit in the round you will turn you work after each row specifics are given for each stitchnerd rowan renew recycled wool on 5mm us 8 row in the instructions © susan ashcroft 2013 - for personal non-commercial use only clever cowl cullercoats 2 making the cowl using the mc cast on a multiple of 4 + 3 stitches i used 99 - see sizing table on pg 3 both row are the same you just change colour mc row k2 *sl1pw wyif k3 repeat from * to the last stitch sl1pw wyif turn your work cross your yarns with the cc on top see photo below cc row k2 *sl1pw wyif k3 repeat from * to the last stitch sl1pw wyif turn your work cross your yarns with the mc on top see below be sure that your stitches are not twisted when you join repeat these 2 row end with a mc row reserving enough for a bind-off row for the bind-off row do not turn working in the round k1 and then bind-off all stitches knitwise i used basic lifted bind-off this will take the cc right up to the edge if you prefer you could reserve a little more yarn and work 1 extra mc row before working the bind-off crossing the yarns the photo shows the mc underneath rust and the cc on top the cross at the end of the mc row just remember that the old yarn is always underneath and the new yarn on top for help chat and maybe a kal why not join us in the stitchnerds group on ravelry © susan ashcroft 2013 -
